about.description:
libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO) Subsystem.
The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some
sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This
includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance to
Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,
Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs
(Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF
transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),
or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,
Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.
about.license: LGPL-2.1-or-later AND GPL-3.0-or-later AND ISC AND BSD-2-Clause
about.summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices

index.license: LGPL-2.1-or-later AND GPL-3.0-or-later AND ISC AND BSD-2-Clause
index.name: libiio-c

name: libiio-c
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.4
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: libiio-c
  version: '0.23'
source:
  - patches: null
    sha256: df1577740ea93dca732e7d7c04786600cb083117901dee793f3d38980754af00
    url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio/archive/v0.23.tar.gz
  - folder: deps/wingetopt
    sha256: 482082f678aba30edd3b5008b72e1c6c984bc8fb4c181abf0f8880e893169ff0
    url: https://github.com/alex85k/wingetopt/archive/76a5d1ab15f684d4c9479a32624d65b3bd1a726b.tar.gz
build:
  number: 0
  run_exports:
    - libiio-c >=0.23,<1.0a0
  string: h7bb1080_0
requirements:
  build:
    - cmake 3.21.1 h39d44d4_0
    - ninja 1.10.2 h5362a0b_0
    - ucrt 10.0.20348.0 h57928b3_0
    - vs2015_runtime 14.29.30037 h902a5da_5
    - vs2017_win-64 19.16.27038 h2e3bad8_2
    - vswhere 2.8.4 h57928b3_0
  host:
    - libiconv 1.16 he774522_0
    - libusb 1.0.24 h8ffe710_4
    - libxml2 2.9.12 hf5bbc77_0
    - lz4-c 1.9.3 h8ffe710_1
    - ucrt 10.0.20348.0 h57928b3_0
    - vc 14.2 hb210afc_5
    - vs2015_runtime 14.29.30037 h902a5da_5
    - xz 5.2.5 h62dcd97_1
    - zlib 1.2.11 h62dcd97_1010
    - zstd 1.5.0 h6255e5f_0
  run:
    - libusb >=1.0.24,<2.0a0
    - libxml2 >=2.9.12,<2.10.0a0
    - vc >=14.1,<15.0a0
    - vs2015_runtime >=14.16.27012
    - zstd >=1.5.0,<1.6.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - iio_attr --help
    - iio_genxml --help
    - iio_info --help
    - iio_readdev --help
    - iio_reg --help
    - iio_writedev --help
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\include\\iio.h exit 1
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\bin\\libiio.dll exit 1
    - if not exist %PREFIX%\\Library\\lib\\libiio.lib exit 1
about:
  description: 'libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO)
    Subsystem.

    The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some

    sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This

    includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance
    to

    Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,

    Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs

    (Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF

    transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),

    or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,

    Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  doc_url: https://analogdevicesinc.github.io/libiio/
  home: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  license: LGPL-2.1-or-later AND GPL-3.0-or-later AND ISC AND BSD-2-Clause
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - COPYING.txt
    - COPYING_GPL.txt
    - LICENSE_WINGETOPT.txt
  summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: libiio
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ryanvolz
